Description: Slightly concave lip sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery Castulo cup; heavy build; lip inset on exterior, offset on interior; glazed black on interior and exterior; inscription cut on exterior.
Curator's comments: Marked in pencil '180'. See the discussion in A. Johnston and I. Chirpanlieva 2016-17, ‘Greek graffito on an Attic black glazed cup from Byblos’, Archaeology and History in the Lebanon 44-45, 160-164, esp. 162-3 fig. 2.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 22.2.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1622)
